ีึีกีบีกึีกีฏีธึีด ีฐีกีพีกึีฅีฌีธีพ 31 700 ึีธึึีกึีกึีซี ีนีซ ีฏีกึีฅีฌีซ ีบีกีฐีกีถีปีฅีฌ ีฅึีฏึีซ ีพีกึีนีกีบีฅีฟีซ ีฐึีกีชีกึีกีฏีกีถีจ, ีธึีซีถ ีจีถีฟึีฅีฌ ีง ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ึีกีถ 680 000 ึีกีฒีกึีกึีซ, ีกีฝีธึีด ีง ิฑิบ ยซีีกีฒีกึีกึีซีกีฏีกีถ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีกีฃีซึยป ีญีดีขีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีกีฟีฃีกีดีกีพีธึ ิฑึีธึีฝีตีกีฏ ีีธึีฌีฐีกีฏีตีกีถีจ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ิฑึีทีกีฌีธึีตีฝ ีีฒีคีฅีฝีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด:
ีีธึีฌีฐีกีฏีตีกีถีซ ีญีธีฝึีธีพี ีจีถีคีคีซีดีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีฉีธีฒ ีถีกีญ ีฅึีฏีญีธีฝีซ ีฐีกีฝีกึีกีฏีธึีฉีตีกีถ, ีฐีฅีฟีธ ีซีทีญีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีฅีฟ: ีีธึีฌีฐีกีฏีตีกีถีจ ีขีธีฒีธึีซ ีฃีธึีฎีธีฒีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีถ ีกีถีพีกีถีธึีด ีง ีฐีฅีฒีกีทึีปีดีกีถ ีฑีกีญีธีฒีพีกีฎ ึีธึีฑ:
* ิธีฝีฟ ิปึีกีฆีฅีฏ ึีกีฒีกึีกึีซีถีฅึีซ ีดีซีกีพีธึีธึีด ีิฟ-ีซ ีฐีกีทีพีกึีฏีซี ีดีกีตีซีฝีซ 9-ีซีถ ีีกีถึีกีบีฅีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐึีกีบีกึีกีฏีธึีด ีฐีกีพีกึีพีกีฎ ีง ีฅีฒีฅีฌ 31 700 ีฐีธีฃีซึ ิธีฝีฟ ีฐีกีถึีกีฐีกีพีกึีซ ีฏีกีฆีดีกีฏีฅึีบีซีนีถีฅึีซี ีกีตีค ีฉีซีพีถ ีงีกีบีฅีฝ ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ีง ีฅีฒีฅีฌึ

media:group.media:description:
๐ The "Tavush for the Homeland" movement led by Archbishop Bagrat Galstanyan held a rally in Yerevanโs Republic Square. The demonstrators are demanding Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan's resignation. ๐ On a trip to Moscow, Pashinyan reached an agreement with Vladimir Putin to withdraw Russian troops from Armenia's eastern border and Zvartnots International Airport. ๐ Dr. Denis Mukwege was awarded the Aurora Prize for Awakening Humanity. Aurora Prize co-founder Ruben Vardanyan is enduring an illegal detainment by Azerbaijan. ๐ WATCH MORE: Insights with Eric- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sdWlco8GZEM

entry.title: Unpacking The Tavush To Yerevan Protest Movement

media:group.media:title: Unpacking The Tavush To Yerevan Protest Movement
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet Podcast, host Patrick Elliott and Eric Hacopian unpack the protest movement led by archbishop Bagrat Srpazan Galstanyan, sparked by the delimitation agreement with Azerbaijan over sections of the border in Armeniaโs northeastern Tavush region. They explore the movement, its leaders, their demands, as well as who is taking part and why, and finally analyze whether or not this movement poses a real threat to the current government.

entry.title: Stirrings of Solidarity: Assessing Protests and Demands in Georgia

media:group.media:title: Stirrings of Solidarity: Assessing Protests and Demands in Georgia
media:group.media:description:
On this week's edition of Insights, Eric Hacopian discusses the latest anti-government protests in Georgia and what they mean for democracy in the region. He also analyzes new positive developments regarding the International Criminal Court case against Israel and what that means for Azerbaijan and the progress being made towards accountability. Eric also analyzes the implications of Hungary's blocking of EU military aid to Armenia, and what Yerevan's options are amid challenging geopolitical situations.
